name: Hyatt Hotel Canberra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms at the Hyatt are spacious and well furnished, with a great attention to detail in terms of amenities. There a comfortable king size bed and a large marble bathroom in each room.
reviews.title: Good old fashioned style, but not good old fashioned service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a five-star hotel (yes it is the only one in Canberra) the service could improve. The front desk is okay but anyone else walking around looks all at sea.
reviews.title: Staff inattentive and disorganised

likes.liked: — Large, luxurious spa in the bathroom
likes.disliked: — The staff were unable or unwilling to supply our basic package, let alone take the extra step with service to impress.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast and lunch buffet are fantastic, although a little overpriced even by hotel standards.
reviews.title: Fantastic guest areas, exceptional service, quite average rooms

likes.disliked: — scabby paint, noise from other room, curtains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Given the lack of other options in Canberra it's a great place to stay, but don't expect the same quality as a hotel of comparable price in Sydney or Melbourne. Prestige breeds contempt.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night in February 2008. We stayed here as it was the only 5 star accommodation in Canberra, and we wanted something special for such a special occasion. Plus, we knew the rooms had lovely big marble bathrooms with large double spas rather than corner spas, which appealed.
reviews.title: What you see is not what you get...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Canberra.
reviews.title: Return to Yesteryear at the Hyatt Canberra

likes.disliked: — White marble flooring in bahrooms could do with some attention.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival the staff were extremely courtious and showed terrific professionalism and enthusiasm as they went about thier responsibilities.
reviews.title: Dont stay here .Stay elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful stylish hotel and in a good location.
reviews.title: Respectable but not quite 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our room was large and well maintained although it is starting to show its age. Bathroom was huge and had a nice soak while staying there.
reviews.title: The best in Canberra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast had a good variety although service was slow if you wanted a fresh made omelette (but worth the wait). I provided feedback to the hotel about the breakfast setup but so far have not received a reply. Would expect a 5 star hotel to at least says thanks for your feedback.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel but forget about the gym/"spa"

likes.disliked: — The so-called gym and spa facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: Overall a good experience.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but staff needs training

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008
reviews.text: Note we did not try the gym but as a previous contributor notes it is out the back and we didnt think it looked appealing when we walked by.
reviews.title: Hotel is 5 star but don't expect personal service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This place is a pretentious hole. The abrupt check in girl was dismissive after I answered "thanks but no thanks" to their valet car parking service. When I asked where I should park for my room, her full directions were "you can park around the side if you want". Even though I mentioned that I had not stayed at the hotel before ,she could not be bothered to provide any directions about how to get in to the hotel from the car park. (Note there is ample free parking on the north side of the hotel, but only two entrances at the front (east) an back (west) of the extensive building.
reviews.title: Get me out of here

likes.liked: — Bathroom was nearly bigger than the main room
likes.disliked: — Feels like youre in the middle of nowhere trapped with pretentious fools

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are nice, but very expensive for their cramped size. Some of the staff are genuinely polite and helpful, but the majority appear to revel in being pretentious, as if this adds to the prestige of the hotel.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Canberra

likes.liked: — The size of the rooms and shower
likes.disliked: — The outdated decor of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the Hyatts add says, its close to everything, but only if your world is old parliament, or new parliament house. Apart from that there is nothing within walking distance. No other restaurants, pubs, shops anything. If you have a car you can drive, but walking is a hike especially in the stinking hot Aust summer, or Canberas famous fridgid winters.
reviews.title: 5 star my hat

likes.liked: — Location for being able to walk to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The buffet was your normal RSL fare, but of course at 5 star prices. The menu selections were boring and unimaginative (Thai green chicken curry, one of my favorites when done well but the Hyatts version was insipid, not to mention the crunchy cooked, but then dried out rice)
reviews.title: Terrible rooms. very, very tired (even after a refurb)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do your self a favour, steer clear of this hotel that can boast about the esoteric while ignoring the practicalities of what makes a good hotel great. In these times of competition for the tourist dollar the Hyatt Canberra really needs to get focused.
reviews.title: The only choice in Canberra

likes.liked: — So quiet you can hear a pin drop.
likes.disliked: — No hot breakfast items in the Ambassador Lounge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got engaged at the Hyatt in 2007 and decided to use it as the venue for our wedding ceremony. I would have to say that the ceremony was great and went without a hitch, I wish I could say the same for the room.
reviews.title: Not worth the 5 star rating

likes.disliked: — The overpriced room service and the lack of a tidy room when we returned at the end of the night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We payed for the Club Deluxe room and at nearly $500 I have to say I was very disappointed. The rooms are tired and the shower screen has mould growing on it. We asked them to tidy up the room after we finished getting ready so it looked nice when we returned but arrived to find the bed turned down but dirty glasses and plates everywhere. Tidying up your room in the wedding dress and suit is not how you envisage spending your wedding night! The included breakfast for the next morning was average. There were no plates and there wasn't a huge range of stuff on offer. Would I stay at the Hyatt in Canberra again... probably not.
reviews.title: Inbetween Hyatt and Park Hyatt
loved the hotel
reviews.text: The title of the review can be explained by the fact that the customer service of the hotel was outstanding and places it above most standard Hyatt hotels, however, the tired feel of the hotel never quite allows for a Park Hyatt experience (Park Hyatt is the higher level of Hyatt hotels).

reviews.title: Just O.K.
reviews.text: From the bell boys, to reception (fantastic Stephen!), the customer service was spot on. Very polite, friendly, everything that could be expected. We had a nice lunch at the restaurant where the food was modern Australian (International mixture of flavours), but like another reviewer pointed out, it could have had more local produce as Canberra is surrounding by a well regarded farming community providing excellent foods. Our standard King room was spacious, glorious bathroom, relaxing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself has a faded appearance, the choice of carpet colours (or is it the age) doesn't give a pampering feel. There was a nice pianist and high tea when we stayed. Because the hotel is the only 5 star hotel in Canberra, many locals come to the restaurant / lounge which is fine - but for our high tea it seemed that the girls were a little over run by the shear number of people and could have made a tiny little more effort to smile a little. Aside from this morning tea event, the hotel was quite.
reviews.title: Classy, although the rooms are a little tired

description: Heritage Listed Hotel which retains many of the classic Art Deco design elements of the original building built in 1924.
